intro: Matelea holtonii, commonly known as the Holton's mallow, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton, and is characterized by its showy, pentagonal flowers. The plant typically grows in arid or semi-arid environments, thriving in well-drained soils. Its leaves are palmately lobed, and the flowers are usually pink to reddish in color. Matelea holtonii is often found in rocky habitats and is adapted to withstand drought conditions.
